title: Mount Wellington (New York)
text: Mount Wellington is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located in the <a href="Central%20New%20York%20Region">Central New York Region</a> of <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>. It is located south of the Hamlet of <a href="Springfield%20Center%2C%20New%20York">Springfield Center</a> at the northern end of <a href="Otsego%20Lake%20%28New%20York%29">Otsego Lake</a>. Mount Wellington rises above lake level. The extreme southern point of the mountain is called <a href="Clarke%20Point">Clarke Point</a> and also referred to as the Shad Cam. It is known as "The Sleeping Lion", as it looks similar to a lion laying down, viewed from <a href="Cooperstown%2C%20New%20York">Cooperstown, New York</a>. It was originally named Mount Millington, but was renamed by <a href="Hyde%20Hall">George Hyde Clarke</a> in honor of <a href="Field%20Marshal%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Field Marshal</a> <a href="Arthur%20Wellesley%2C%201st%20Duke%20of%20Wellington">The 1st Duke of Wellington</a>, the victor of <a href="Battle%20of%20Waterloo">Waterloo</a>, who had been Clarke's schoolmate at <a href="Eton%20College">Eton College</a> in England.
